entry.title: elive 3.0
entry.summary: It was eight years until the developers of the Linux Elive distribution were able to launch a new version . Elive is a very…
entry.content:
It was eight years until the developers of the Linux Elive distribution were able to launch a new version . Elive is a very stable , non-commercial free operating systemthat may be a good option to replace your default system on your computer.

This system is maintained by a donation system and is developed by a single person.Elive provides an intuitive experience in a system completely ready for daily use.

 

 

 

 

The desktop is a very personalized version of Enlightenment that offers a light and beautiful experience that works great even on older computers.

This Linux distribution is based on the GNU / Linux Debian distribution which is based on providing a perfectly stable and powerful system.

It can be run directly in live mode without the need to install with its own guided persistence feature.

 

 

 

In addition to this if you want to turn your computer into a powerful workstation, this Linux distro has a very friendly installer that includes many features to facilitate the process.

Elive is a mix between an easy-to-use system for inexperienced users and includes incredibly useful tools for the advanced , this hybrid system so to speak comes in the form of a clean and beautiful desktop but powerful for any task.

Of the main features that we can highlight from this distribution are:

  • Lightness and speed
  • Effects and a beautiful desktop
  • Intuitive and simple
  • Guided and automated
  • Full, full of applications and features
  • Multimedia
  • Own features and integration
  • Futuristic and clean desk
  • Comfortable to work
  • It is not necessary to install and save sessions
  • Installer with migration, update and automatic modes
  • It works with 256 MB of RAM and 500 MHz CPU
  • Full root access
  • Programming functions

About the new release of Elive

A few days ago the developer of the Linux distribution Elive announced through a statement on his blog the availability of the new version of the distribution.

Thus Thanatermesis blog announcement:

After 8 years of silent development, the third stable version of Elive is available, the result is simply incredible and the integration is magnificent, it is not even possible to describe each internal function and the new website only contains a small portion of its features.

Unfortunately, not everything is rainbow and perfection, the lack of resources caused the launch to be delayed too much, and this led to old packages and controllers, but despite that, the final result is really worth it, Elive 3.0 is the most useful that was created.

Under the hood, Elive 3.0 is based on Debian 7 (“Wheezy”), along with the adapted Enlightenment 17 desktop environment .

Elive only requires 192 MB of main memory according to system requirements and is only available as a 32-bit version , with kernel that uses PAE. The distribution is not compatible with UEFI firmware, but it also runs on older hardware.

The latter, however, takes 24 hours.

Basically in this new version of the distribution we can highlight:

  • Improved designs and beautiful interfaces made by professional designers.
  • Better performance, integrity and features.
  • More tools to make your own hacks and customizations.
  • Make many ideas come true.

Download Elive 3.0

Users can download the distribution immediately after a donation . If you cannot or do not want to pay, you must download the distribution through the torrents network or request the download link by email.

For this you must go to the official website of the project and in its downloads section you can obtain the download link of the distribution by placing your email. The link is this.

Or as mentioned above you can download the distribution from Torrent, for this you must download the following Torrent file which you must use with a Torrent client which you can find some that we recommend here in the blog. The link is this.

And to record the image on a USB I can recommend the use of etcher

entry.title: College Fun Parties
entry.summary: College graduation parties are a great opportunity to celebrate the accomplishments of your young adult. Whether big or small, a graduation party should be all…
entry.content:
College graduation parties are a great opportunity to celebrate the accomplishments of your young adult. Whether big or small, a graduation party should be all about the graduate and what they want to do. It also allows parents, friends, and family to celebrate. 

 

If you need a few ideas to get you started, here are some that are sure to be crowd-pleasers for any graduation celebration.

 

Decorate and Celebrate

    • Contact your graduate's friends and family and ask them to send photos of them with the graduate, along with a sentence or two about how they met or a favorite memory. Create a memory board of these sentimental moments for everyone at the party to enjoy. 
    • Order a life-size cutout of your graduate and have your guests sign it. It will be a fun keepsake and a great conversation starter. Get some metallic permanent markets to make it especially festive.
    • Decorate your home or party venue with everything in your graduate's school colors. From balloons to paper plates, make it a rah-rah moment for your grad. You can even ask your guests to dress in the school colors if you think they would be up for it. 
    • Did your graduate go Greek? If so, have a few items on display with the fraternity or sorority letters and mascot. 
    • Create a timeline with class photos of your graduate through the years to hang up at the party. Label each photo with the grade and year it was taken or play a game and have guests guess the grade and age.
 
 

Games and Entertainment

    • Ask one of your graduate's friends to put together a music playlist for the party featuring your grad's favorite songs. 
    • Everyone has some advice to give to a new graduate; to gather these words of wisdom in an organized way, create an advice jar. Get some colorful pens, small pieces of paper, and a large jar, and ask your guests to share their best advice with the grad. 
    • What's a party without games? Graduation mad-libs are fun and easy to play. Another fun game is "Who am I?" Have guests write down a memory they shared with the graduate, read them aloud, and have the guest of honor guess who wrote the memory. 
    • Instant print cameras are a little old school and a lot of fun. Pick up one—along with plenty of film—and some graduation props, and let your guests take photos of themselves and your graduate. Tape them into a blank book for an instant memento. 
    • Create an Instagram hashtag for your grad's party so everyone can share their photos on the app. For example, #Kelseygrad or #MattMichigan. 
 
  • Hang a wall map and get small flags. Encourage all of your guests to write their name and college alma mater on the flags or a piece of paper and stick them on the map in the right location. 
 

Food and Drink

  • If your graduate spent a semester abroad, use that country as the theme for the food and drinks at the party. For example, serve a pasta bar for Italy, tapas for Spain, or fish and chips for England. 
  • A signature cocktail named for your graduate is a fun idea. 
  • Make a few fun graduation-themed treats like colorful cupcakes or cap and gown shaped cookies. 
 

Party Favors and More

  • Order business cards, inexpensive or luxe, with the graduate's new address, job info, email address, phone number, and their graduation photo. This is a fun way to give everyone the information they need to keep in touch with your graduate.
  • Summer-themed party gifts can be cute or practical. Mini sunscreens, beer cozies, or sunglasses are all great parting gifts. 
 

Thank You Notes

  • Be sure to order thank you notes for your graduate to use to write to all of the guests and acknowledge their gifts.
